```markdown ‚Äî title: Submit a New Resource parent: Community nav_order: 3 ‚Äî

Submit a Resource

Have a valuable open-source project, dataset, tutorial, or scientific link?
You can help the global community by submitting it to the SGCCRfC Wiki.

üìù What You Can Submit

We accept resources related to:

  • Cloud & grid computing
  • HPC & cluster systems
  • Mathematics & numerical algorithms
  • Physics, chemistry, biology
  • Geoscience, remote sensing, GNSS
  • Seismology, geodesy, volcanology
  • Machine learning & AI for scientific use
  • Open-source software and GitHub projects
  • Scientific data repositories
  • Educational videos and tutorials

üß≠ Submission Methods

Method 1 ‚Äî GitHub Issue (Recommended)

Go to:
üëâ https://github.com/sgccrfc/SGCCRfC-Wiki/issues
Choose ‚ÄúResource Suggestion‚Äù template and provide:

  • Resource title
  • URL
  • Category/domain
  • Short description
  • Why it is relevant

Method 2 ‚Äî Pull Request

If you prefer to add the file directly:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Add your resource under the appropriate Markdown page
  3. Submit a Pull Request

Method 3 ‚Äî Email Submission

For contributors without GitHub
üìß Email (coming soon)

‚úî Resource Acceptance Rules

Submitted resources should:

  • Be publicly accessible
  • Preferably open-source (MIT/GPL/BSD/Apache)
  • Have scientific or educational value
  • Be stable and well-maintained
  • Not contain copyrighted or restricted materials

üôå Thank You for Contributing!

Your submission helps expand the global scientific knowledge base.
